p: We considered metabolic acidosis to be defined as a serum HCO 3 <15 mmol/L. Likewise proteinuria is defined as protein urine ≥30 mg/dL or dipstick urine protein +1 or above; hematuria is defined as RBC ≥5 cells/HPF, or dipstick urine blood +2 or above; pyuria is defined as presence of WBC ≥3 cells/HPF, or a urine dipstick positive for leukocyte esterase. Rhabdomyolysis is defined as elevated creatine phosphokinase (CPK) >5x upper normal limit.
